# Sweden – Wise Group plans to divest Comaea International

21 October 2019

Swedish staffing firm Wise Group (WISE: SS) announced that it plans to divest
Comaea as part of the restructuring of its subsidiary Edge HR AB.

Wise Group said it expects total proceeds from divestment to be at most SEK 17
million (€1.5 million).

Wise Group first [acquired
Comaea's](https://www2.staffingindustry.com/eng_member/Editorial/Daily-
News/Sweden-Wise-Group-acquires-competency-management-software-provider-35333)
Swedish operations in September 2015. The acquisition includes all customer
and cooperation agreements in Sweden.

Comaea develops and markets talent management systems that help companies,
authorities and organisations identify employees' skills and, as a starting
point, plan their work.

“Wise Group has entered into an agreement with Comaea to divest customer and
collaboration agreements and the exclusive license to sell and develop the
Comaea CMS (content management software) software through a transfer
agreement. The transaction is conditional on certain conditions being met,”
Wise Group stated. “The Wise Group Board now intends to divest the Comaea
business area as a step in the previously communicated restructuring of the
subsidiary Edge HR AB.”

The expected divestment of Comaea is a cash transaction and the sales proceeds
amount to at least SEK 8.5 million (€0.7 million), with a possible additional
liquidity based on Comaea's sales development during 2020 - 2023. The total
sales proceeds may reach a maximum of SEK 17.0 million (€1.5 million).

The sale is conditional upon customary MBL (Co-determination in the Workplace
Act) negotiations being completed satisfactorily. Wise Group said that entry
will be made after these conditions are met.
